results.title: Blindsided Abroad: Vaccinated but Testing Positive on a Trip to Europe
results.abstract: The prevalence of the Delta variant means many travelers, including those who are vaccinated, are facing sickness, quarantines and delayed returns.

multimedia.caption: April DeMuth and her partner, Warren Watson, at their home in Hilton Head, S.C. They got sick on their Greek vacation, and had to be quarantined. “We had our vaccinations cards, we felt healthy, we’re in our 50s, it really didn’t occur to us that we had Covid.”
multimedia.copyright: Adam Kuehl for The New York Times

results.title: Earthquake and floods have set back Haiti’s faltering effort to curb the pandemic.

results.title: ‘There’s So Much More to Afghanistan’: Khaled Hosseini Reflects on His Birthplace
results.abstract: The author of “The Kite Runner” and “A Thousand Splendid Suns” talks about the pain and frustration of watching the country from afar.

multimedia.caption: Khaled Hosseini in Jordan in 2018. The best-selling author was born in Afghanistan, and several of his books are rooted in its history.
multimedia.copyright: Jordi Matas/UNHCR

results.title: Ashraf Ghani says he fled Afghanistan to avoid being lynched.
results.abstract: The former Afghan leader, who is now in the United Arab Emirates, vowed to return to a country now controlled by the Taliban.

multimedia.caption: “If I had stayed in Afghanistan, the people of Afghanistan would have witnessed the president hanged once more,” Ashraf Ghani said.
multimedia.copyright: Reuters

results.title: Israel, Once the Model for Beating Covid, Faces New Surge of Infections
results.abstract: One of the most vaccinated societies, Israel now has one of the highest infection rates in the world, raising questions about the vaccine’s efficacy.

multimedia.caption: A coronavirus isolation ward last week in Safed, Israel. Infections have more than doubled in the last two weeks.
multimedia.copyright: Jalaa Marey/AFP — Getty Images
